instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message:
water damage at u8020 area and u5870 area(was replace both) no other seeing damage.
charger green/orange, no fan
PPBUS-12V
PP5V rail pulse from 0-3v constantly.

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message:
"PPBUS-12V"
You have more than 2 years on the forum; didn't learn yet the importance of exact voltage???
Check it w/ and w/o battery connected.
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 60/85W charger.

CPU coils pulse too?
What about PLT_RESET_L?
Try starting in SMC bypass mode.

I recommend you to reball SMC...

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message:
PPBUS-12.5V :)
PLT_RESET_L-0v
CPU coils no pulse
dont pass SMC
i was reball SMC but the same..

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message: Any other coil, apart of 3V3/5V and CPU core, pulsing?

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message: Check power on sequence and see what's wrong.

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H = 12.58
PP3V42_G3H = 3.4V
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.3V
PP5V_S5 = 5V 
PM_SLP_S5_L 0V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN - 3.3V
PM_BATLOW_L - 3.3V trigger working.
PM_SLP_SUS_L - 0V
3V3_SUS - 0V
PM_RSMRST_L = 0V 
PM_DSW_PWRGD - 0v
PCH_DSWVRMEN- 3.2v

dont bypass SMC

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message:
"PM_BATLOW_L - 3.3V trigger working."
I'm not sure what do you mean here; it MUST be steady high.

"PM_SLP_SUS_L - 0V"
Check PCH's RTC signals.

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message:
update:
after replace SMC:
3V3_SUS 3.3V
PM_SLP_SUS_L 3.3V
PM_DSW_PWRGD 3.4V
PM_RSMRST_L 3.3V
PM_SLP_S5_L 0V

PM_BATLOW_L - 3.3V when i trigger SMC_ON/OFF_L its down to 0v and back to 3.3v

still SMC bypass not working..
fan not spin

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message: yes, when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L ,  PM_PWRBTN_L down to 0v and go back up to 3.4v

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message: Can you detect pulse at PM_SLP_S4_L (at same time)?

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message: yes it jump to almost 1v and down back to 0v

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message:
Do the same for PM_SLP_S3L.
If pulse, then big coils should pulse too.
Also check ALL_SYS_PWRGD and PLT_RESET_L (for pulse).

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message: PM_SLP_S3L,  ALL_SYS_PWRGD and  PLT_RESET_L all pulse just when i trigger SMC_ONOFF_L.

threads.title: 820-4924 water damage  PP5V rail pulsing
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.
Be sure no corrosion under U1950 and/or U6100/01, J6100.

Check for pulse on output voltages from page 63.
If no pulse, check for short, or lower than normal resistance to ground.
